channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Sri Lanka Declares ‘Largest’ Disaster as Cyclone Death Toll Rises to 355
item.description: The president called the nationwide flooding the largest and most challenging natural disaster in the island’s history, as emergency rescue efforts co...

item.title: Trump Pauses All Asylum Applications, and China’s Fast-Food Brands Make a Play for the U.S.
item.description: Plus, how young is too young for a smartphone?

item.title: ‘Santa Rally’ stalls even though a December cut from the Fed is a near certainty
item.description: Unfortunately, the tech sector is spoiling the party: Bitcoin sank to $85K early this morning.

item.title: DoorDash CEO Tony Xu outmaneuvered Uber Eats by obsessing over his customer
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Netanyahu’s Pardon Request Borrows From Trump’s Playbook
item.description: In many ways, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s request mimics how President Trump has assailed his perceived enemies and attacked legal proceedings...

item.title: Inside the Bird-Flu Vaccine Trial for Monk Seals
item.description: After the virus returned to Hawaii this fall, testing the shots in the endangered seal species became urgent.

item.title: Supreme Court to Hear Copyright Battle Over Online Music Piracy
item.description: At issue is whether internet providers can be held liable for repeated copyright infringements of users, with potentially billions of dollars on the l...

item.title: Elon Musk says only AI and robotics can solve the ‘insanely high’ $38 trillion national debt crisis—but it would cause ‘significant deflation’
item.description: After clashing with Trump on spending, Musk argues AI and robotics are the only path to easing record U.S. debt costs—and may even trigger future defl...

item.title: Insiders say the future of AI will be smaller and cheaper than you think
item.description: Bigger is not necessarily better, these execs say.

item.title: The AI boom is driving valuations sky-high almost overnight. What could go wrong?
item.description: This year, a handful of top AI startups, from Anthropic to Harvey, have raised not just one giant round of funding, but two or more.

item.title: Zelensky Turns to Europe After Talks With U.S. Officials
item.description: Ukraine’s president met with President Emmanuel Macron of France on Monday as Steve Witkoff, President Trump’s special envoy, was traveling to Russia.
